channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Towards an Awareness of Time Series Anomaly Detection Models' Adversarial Vulnerability
item.description: To the best of our understanding, we demonstrate, for the first time, the vulnerabilities of anomaly detection systems against adversarial attacks.

item.title: Self-Filtering: A Noise-Aware Sample Selection for Label Noise with Confidence Penalization
item.description: Sample selection is an effective strategy to mitigate the effect of label noise in robust learning.

item.title: On the Design of Privacy-Aware Cameras: a Study on Deep Neural Networks
item.description: At the same time, we ensure that useful non-sensitive data can still be extracted from distorted images.

item.title: Fast Nearest Convolution for Real-Time Efficient Image Super-Resolution
item.description: The proposed nearest convolution has the same performance as the nearest upsampling but is much faster and more suitable for Android NNAPI.

item.title: Sliding Window Recurrent Network for Efficient Video Super-Resolution
item.description: Different from single image super-resolution, VSR can utilize frames' temporal information to reconstruct results with more details.

item.title: A novel approach for Fair Principal Component Analysis based on eigendecomposition
item.description: Principal component analysis (PCA), a ubiquitous dimensionality reduction technique in signal processing, searches for a projection matrix that minimizes the mean squared error between the reduced dataset and the original one.

item.title: Unrestricted Black-box Adversarial Attack Using GAN with Limited Queries
item.description: First, we demonstrate that our targeted attack method is query-efficient to produce unrestricted adversarial examples for a facial identity recognition model that contains 307 identities.

item.title: Tracking by weakly-supervised learning and graph optimization for whole-embryo C. elegans lineages
item.description: Our work specifically addresses the following challenging properties of C. elegans embryo recordings: (1) Many cell divisions as compared to benchmark recordings of other organisms, and (2) the presence of polar bodies that are easily mistaken as cell nuclei.

item.title: Q-Net: Query-Informed Few-Shot Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Deep learning has achieved tremendous success in computer vision, while medical image segmentation (MIS) remains a challenge, due to the scarcity of data annotations.

item.title: DCSF: Deep Convolutional Set Functions for Classification of Asynchronous Time Series
item.description: Because of the asynchronous nature, they pose a significant challenge to deep learning architectures, which presume that the time series presented to them are regularly sampled, fully observed, and aligned with respect to time.

item.title: Applying Eigencontours to PolarMask-Based Instance Segmentation
item.description: Eigencontours are the first data-driven contour descriptors based on singular value decomposition.

item.title: RZSR: Reference-based Zero-Shot Super-Resolution with Depth Guided Self-Exemplars
item.description: To advance ZSSR, we obtain reference image patches with rich textures and high-frequency details which are also extracted only from the input image using cross-scale matching.

item.title: Adjoint Optimisation for Wind Farm Flow Control with a Free-Vortex Wake Model
item.description: The free-vortex wake model with gradient information shows potential for efficient optimisation and provides a promising way to further explore dynamic wind farm flow control.

item.title: Semi-supervised Semantic Segmentation with Mutual Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Consistency regularization has been widely studied in recent semi-supervised semantic segmentation methods.

item.title: Bugs in the Data: How ImageNet Misrepresents Biodiversity
item.description: We find that many of the classes are ill-defined or overlapping, and that 12% of the images are incorrectly labeled, with some classes having >90% of images incorrect.

item.title: Secondary Protein Structure Prediction Using Neural Networks
item.description: Secondly, we test the impact of varying the length of protein sequence we input into the model.

item.title: A Deep Learning Approach Using Masked Image Modeling for Reconstruction of Undersampled K-spaces
item.description: The model was evaluated through L1 loss, gradient normalization, and structural similarity values.

item.title: Molecular Substructure-Aware Network for Drug-Drug Interaction Prediction
item.description: Concomitant administration of drugs can cause drug-drug interactions (DDIs).

item.title: Enhancing Deep Learning Performance of Massive MIMO CSI Feedback
item.description: In this paper, we propose a jigsaw puzzles aided training strategy (JPTS) to enhance the deep learning-based Massive MIMO CSI feedback approaches by maximizing mutual information between the original CSI and the compressed CSI.

item.title: YOLOPv2: Better, Faster, Stronger for Panoptic Driving Perception
item.description: Over the last decade, multi-tasking learning approaches have achieved promising results in solving panoptic driving perception problems, providing both high-precision and high-efficiency performance.

item.title: Self-Supervised Endoscopic Image Key-Points Matching
item.description: Feature matching and finding correspondences between endoscopic images is a key step in many clinical applications such as patient follow-up and generation of panoramic image from clinical sequences for fast anomalies localization.

item.title: PeRFception: Perception using Radiance Fields
item.description: The recent progress in implicit 3D representation, i. e., Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), has made accurate and photorealistic 3D reconstruction possible in a differentiable manner.

item.title: Of Human Criteria and Automatic Metrics: A Benchmark of the Evaluation of Story Generation
item.description: However, there is no consensus on which human evaluation criteria to use, and no analysis of how well automatic criteria correlate with them.

item.title: DPTDR: Deep Prompt Tuning for Dense Passage Retrieval
item.description: We believe this work facilitates the industry, as it saves enormous efforts and costs of deployment and increases the utility of computing resources.

item.title: FactMix: Using a Few Labeled In-domain Examples to Generalize to Cross-domain Named Entity Recognition
item.description: Few-shot Named Entity Recognition (NER) is imperative for entity tagging in limited resource domains and thus received proper attention in recent years.

item.title: Next-Year Bankruptcy Prediction from Textual Data: Benchmark and Baselines
item.description: Models for bankruptcy prediction are useful in several real-world scenarios, and multiple research contributions have been devoted to the task, based on structured (numerical) as well as unstructured (textual) data.

item.title: Interpreting Song Lyrics with an Audio-Informed Pre-trained Language Model
item.description: Lyric interpretations can help people understand songs and their lyrics quickly, and can also make it easier to manage, retrieve and discover songs efficiently from the growing mass of music archives.

item.title: On a Built-in Conflict between Deep Learning and Systematic Generalization
item.description: In this paper, we hypothesize that internal function sharing is one of the reasons to weaken o. o. d.

item.title: Induced Natural Language Rationales and Interleaved Markup Tokens Enable Extrapolation in Large Language Models
item.description: The ability to extrapolate, i. e., to make predictions on sequences that are longer than those presented as training examples, is a challenging problem for current deep learning models.

item.title: Joint Privacy Enhancement and Quantization in Federated Learning
item.description: The distributed operation of FL gives rise to challenges that are not encountered in centralized machine learning, including the need to preserve the privacy of the local datasets, and the communication load due to the repeated exchange of updated models.

item.title: Multi-Modal Representation Learning with Self-Adaptive Thresholds for Commodity Verification
item.description: In this paper, we propose a method to identify identical commodities.

item.title: A flexible empirical Bayes approach to multiple linear regression and connections with penalized regression
item.description: We introduce a new empirical Bayes approach for large-scale multiple linear regression.

item.title: CAPER: Coarsen, Align, Project, Refine - A General Multilevel Framework for Network Alignment
item.description: Network alignment, or the task of finding corresponding nodes in different networks, is an important problem formulation in many application domains.

item.title: Unsupervised Question Answering via Answer Diversifying
item.description: Previous works usually make use of heuristic rules as well as pre-trained models to construct data and train QA models.

item.title: A Constrained Deformable Convolutional Network for Efficient Single Image Dynamic Scene Blind Deblurring with Spatially-Variant Motion Blur Kernels Estimation
item.description: Most existing deep-learning-based single image dynamic scene blind deblurring (SIDSBD) methods usually design deep networks to directly remove the spatially-variant motion blurs from one inputted motion blurred image, without blur kernels estimation.

item.title: On Fitness Landscape Analysis of Permutation Problems: From Distance Metrics to Mutation Operator Selection
item.description: Our implementations of the permutation metrics, permutation mutation operators, and associated evolutionary algorithm, are available in a pair of open source Java libraries.

item.title: CitySim: A Drone-Based Vehicle Trajectory Dataset for Safety Oriented Research and Digital Twins
item.description: The development of safety-oriented research ideas and applications requires fine-grained vehicle trajectory data that not only has high accuracy but also captures a substantial number of critical safety events.

item.title: EpiGNN: Exploring Spatial Transmission with Graph Neural Network for Regional Epidemic Forecasting
item.description: Epidemic forecasting is the key to effective control of epidemic transmission and helps the world mitigate the crisis that threatens public health.

item.title: Learning an Efficient Multimodal Depth Completion Model
item.description: With the wide application of sparse ToF sensors in mobile devices, RGB image-guided sparse depth completion has attracted extensive attention recently, but still faces some problems.

item.title: Efficient Self-Supervision using Patch-based Contrastive Learning for Histopathology Image Segmentation
item.description: Contrastive self-supervised learning provides a framework to learn meaningful representations using learned notions of similarity measures from simple pretext tasks.

item.title: Neural PCA for Flow-Based Representation Learning
item.description: Without exploiting any label information, the principal components recovered store the most informative elements in their \emph{leading} dimensions and leave the negligible in the \emph{trailing} ones, allowing for clear performance improvements of $5\%$-$10\%$ in downstream tasks.

item.title: Ultra-high-resolution unpaired stain transformation via Kernelized Instance Normalization
item.description: Hence, we proposed a strategy for ultra-high-resolution unpaired image-to-image translation: Kernelized Instance Normalization (KIN), which preserves local information and successfully achieves seamless stain transformation with constant GPU memory usage.

item.title: Retinal Structure Detection in OCTA Image via Voting-based Multi-task Learning
item.description: Automated detection of retinal structures, such as retinal vessels (RV), the foveal avascular zone (FAZ), and retinal vascular junctions (RVJ), are of great importance for understanding diseases of the eye and clinical decision-making.

item.title: CM-MLP: Cascade Multi-scale MLP with Axial Context Relation Encoder for Edge Segmentation of Medical Image
item.description: However, those methods have the following challenges when dealing with the edges of the medical images: (1) Previous convolutional-based methods do not focus on the boundary relationship between foreground and background around the segmentation edge, which leads to the degradation of segmentation performance when the edge changes complexly.

item.title: AniWho : A Quick and Accurate Way to Classify Anime Character Faces in Images
item.description: This paper aims to dive more deeply into various models available, including InceptionV3, InceptionResNetV2, MobileNetV2, and EfficientNetB7, using transfer learning to classify Japanese animation-style character faces.

item.title: Integrative conformal p-values for powerful out-of-distribution testing with labeled outliers
item.description: This paper develops novel conformal methods to test whether a new observation was sampled from the same distribution as a reference set.

item.title: Enhancing User Behavior Sequence Modeling by Generative Tasks for Session Search
item.description: To help the encoding of the current user behavior sequence, we propose to use a decoder and the information of future sequences and a supplemental query.

item.title: Distance-Aware Occlusion Detection with Focused Attention
item.description: In this work, (1) we propose a novel three-decoder architecture as the infrastructure for focused attention; 2) we use the generalized intersection box prediction task to effectively guide our model to focus on occlusion-specific regions; 3) our model achieves a new state-of-the-art performance on distance-aware relationship detection.

item.title: IMPaSh: A Novel Domain-shift Resistant Representation for Colorectal Cancer Tissue Classification
item.description: The appearance of histopathology images depends on tissue type, staining and digitization procedure.

item.title: Multi-domain Learning for Updating Face Anti-spoofing Models
item.description: In this work, we study multi-domain learning for face anti-spoofing(MD-FAS), where a pre-trained FAS model needs to be updated to perform equally well on both source and target domains while only using target domain data for updating.
